quote: While they were drinking at the fountain, church clocks began to strike midnight. Missis said gladly, ‚ÄúOh, Pongo, it‚Äôs tomorrow! Now we shall be with our puppies today!‚Äù

quote: At midnight the entrances were thrown wide, and the rabble, surging in, occupied the quarters assigned to them, from which nothing less than an earthquake or an army with spears could have dislodged them. quote:
‚ÄúI thought you asleep,‚Äù he said, presently.
‚ÄúSleep is for old people and little children, and I came out to look at my friends, the stars in the south‚Äîthose now holding the curtains of midnight over the Nile. But confess yourself surprised!‚Äù

quote: Ren said, "If you go to the football field at midnight on Halloween and say his name three times, his ghost is supposed to appear."

quote: "You, Willi, my friend," said Pastor Fritz softly, "you who sit in midnight darkness at midday, is this Jesus Christ a horn of salvation, a light in your darkness?"

quote: You take a black cat---isn't that it?---that does not have even one white hair (you know this), and you bind his four paws, and then you take him at midnight to a crossroads and you cry out in a loud voice:

quote: If Jill had been more used to adventures, she might have doubted the Owl‚Äôs word, but this never occurred to her; and in the exciting idea of a midnight escape she forgot her sleepiness.

author: C.S. Lewis

quote: ‚ÄúAnd almost exactly at midnight, the Count‚Äôs patience was rewarded. For in accordance with the instructions he‚Äôd written to Richard, every telephone on the first floor of the Metropol began to ring.‚Äù

author: Amor Towles

quote: ‚ÄúWins Sibby damn it!‚Äù Mr. Hubert said. ‚ÄúWins Sibby! What the hell else are we setting up till midnight arguing about?‚Äù

author: William Faulkner

quote: Midnight, and there was frost on the fields and patches of black ice on a road notorious for its accidents‚Äîthere were bunches of dead flowers tied to fence posts and telegraph poles, and torn gaps in hedges, like some kind of failed crop.

quote: The Place St. Sulpice, so quiet and deserted, where toward midnight there came every night the woman with the busted umbrella and the crazy veil. Every night she slept there on a bench under her torn umbrella, the ribs hanging down, her dress turning green, her bony fingers and the odor of decay oozing from her body; and in the morning I‚Äôd be sitting there myself, taking a quiet snooze in the sunshine, cursing the god-damned pigeons gathering up the crumbs everywhere.

author: Henry Miller

quote: The house is empty, but Eugene sings as if he had for audience all the crowned heads of Europe. The garden door is open and the odor of wet leaves sops in and the rain blends with Eugene‚Äôs ùò¢ùòØùò®ùò∞ùò™ùò¥ùò¥ùò¶ and ùòµùò≥ùò™ùò¥ùòµùò¶ùò¥ùò¥ùò¶. At midnight, after the spectators have saturated the hall with perspiration and foul breaths, I return to sleep on a bench. The exit light, swimming in a halo of tobacco smoke, sheds a faint light on the lower corner of the asbestos curtain; I close my eyes every night on an artificial eye ...

author: Henry Miller

quote: Trevor had on an Andy Warhol costume: blond bobbed wig, thick black glasses, tight striped shirt. My first impression of him was that he was free spirited, clever, funny. That proved to be completely inaccurate. We left the party together and walked around for hours, lied to each other about our happy lives, ate pizza at midnight, took the Staten Island Ferry back and forth and watched the sun rise.

Fear can clear the mind as well as cloud it, and remembering my ùòãùò∞ùòØ ùòëùò∂ùò¢ùòØ, I hid J. in a nest of coverlets and sheets in my sagging bed and left the curtain half open to show I had nothing to hide.

quote: It was an animal thing. A wilderness thing. Nothing about her belonged to her previous self in that moment. Above all her voice. This could have been the high shriek of a hawk, the soul-haunting howl of a wolf, the rasping cry of a red fox at midnight. It could have been any of them, but not the scream of a sixteen-year-old schoolgirl.
title: The Island of Missing Trees
author: Elif Shafak

quote:
Oliver Dubois rammed a pickup truck through his front door on a sweaty midnight in July, at the tail end of a massive block party.
It wasn‚Äôt his truck, and the street was closed to traffic, so the vehicle‚Äôs emergence out of darkness and slow rumble up Oak Drive scattered neighbors and guests alike into confused groups on candlelit lawns.

quote:
She looked at the digital display of her watch.
00:00:00
Midnight, as the clock had told her.
She waited for the next second to arrive, but it didn‚Äôt.

author: Matt Haig

quote:
Farewell, sweet playfellow: pray thou for us;
And good luck grant thee thy Demetrius!-
Keep word, Lysander: we must starve our sight
From lovers‚Äô food till morrow deep midnight.
title: A Midsummer Night‚Äôs Dream

Did those cold, distant lights watch with any vestige of the humans they had once been, those special, chosen, favored ones who had brushed to close to the divine?

quote: Had the lure of blood and ecstasy in the midnight woods brought her sailing over the glittering blue waters? I wondered why she was here now, in the vineyard.

quote: She summoned the police and, when the men came, sympathetic, at midnight, she gave testimony. To have given a home to the wolf and succour to the rabid dog.

quote: One Christmas at midnight on the button, at the old place, the ward door blows open with a crash, in comes a fat man with a beard, eyes ringed red by the cold and his nose just the color of a cherry.

author: Ken Kesey

quote: At midnight, the lights in the caf√©‚Äôs kitchen could be particularly harsh. Without the comfort of the daylight streaming in through the stained-glass window, everything in the room looked grim and utilitarian.

author: Marsha Mehran

quote: Sometimes there is no darker place than our own thoughts; the moonless midnight of the mind.

author: Dean Koontz

quote: ‚ÄúIt starts at midnight.‚Äù

author: Suzanne Collins

quote: Dawn seemed to follow midnight with indecent haste.

author: J.K. Rowling

quote: ‚ÄúI shall never forget his flying Henry‚Äôs kite for him that very windy day last Easter‚Äîand ever since his particular kindness last September twelvemonth in writing that note, at twelve o‚Äôclock at night, on purpose to assure me that there was no scarlet fever at Cobham, I have been convinced there could not be a more feeling heart nor a better man in existence.‚ÄîIf any body can deserve him, it must be Miss Taylor.‚Äù

author: Jane Austen

quote: On the night after his ride to Lawrenceville a crowd sallied to New York in quest of adventure, and started back to Princeton about twelve o‚Äôclock in two machines. It had been a gay party and different stages of sobriety were represented.

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: As midnight was striking bronze blows upon the dusky air, Dorian Gray, dressed commonly, and with a muffler wrapped round his throat, crept quietly out of his house.

quote: "But wait till I tell you," he said. "We had a midnight lunch too after all the jollification and when we sallied forth it was blue o'clock the morning after the night before."

author: James Joyce

quote: "Midnight," you said. What is midnight to the young? And suddenly a festive blaze was flung Across five cedar trunks, snow patches showed, And a patrol car on our bumpy road Came to a crunching stop. Retake, retake!

author: Vladimir Nabokov

quote: That a man who could hardly see anything more than two feet away from him could be employed as a security guard suggested to me that our job was not to secure anything but to report for work every night, fill the bulky ledger with cryptic remarks like 'Patrolled perimeter 12.00 pm, No Incident' and go to the office every fortnight for our wages and listen to the talkative Ms Elgassier.

quote: Bernardo: 'Tis now struck twelve; get thee to bed, Francisco.

author: William Shakespeare

quote: But in the end I understood this language. I understood it, I understood it, all wrong perhaps. That is not what matters. It told me to write the report. Does this mean I am freer now than I was? I do not know. I shall learn. Then I went back into the house and wrote, It is midnight. The rain is beating on the windows. It was not midnight. It was not raining.

quote: Cartridges not allowed after 0000h., to encourage sleep.

quote: Gately can hear the horns and raised voices and u-turn squeals way down below on Wash. That indicates it's around 0000h., the switching hour.

while I pondered weak and weary,

quote: We have heard the chimes at midnight.

quote: There was the midnight hike with the boys to the end of the promenade and the big argument about the election of a housemaster. What had become of responsibility and service? And brotherly love?

Conrad noticed them immediately, at every street corner, over every archway, three quarters of the way up the sides of buildings, covering every conceivable angle of approach. Most of them were too high off the ground to be reached by anything less than a fireman's ladder and still retained their hands. All registered the same time: 12:01. Conrad looked at his wristwatch, noted that it was just 2:45.
"They were driven by a master dock," Stacey told him. "When that stopped, they all ceased at the same moment. One minute after midnight, thirty-seven years ago."

21st December 1985, 12:18 a.m.

quote: Nobody had been one of Mycroft Ward's most important operatives and for sixty seconds every day, between 12.21 am and 12.22 am., his laptop was permitted to connect directly with the gigantic online database of self that was Mycroft Ward's mind.

quote: The clock marked twenty-three minutes past one. He was suddenly full of agitation, yet hopeful. She had come! Who could tell what she would say? She might offer the most natural explanation of her late arrival.

quote: At twenty-seven minutes past one she felt as if she was levitating out of her body.

quote: He exited the men's room at one-twenty-nine A.M.

quote: On the north-east side of the street, about midway between the fish and flesh markets in the seaport town of Falmouth, and about the silent and solemn hour of thirty-six minutes past one by my father's watch, on the morning of the 28th day of December, His Gracious Majesty George the Second being King of Great Britain and Ireland, (it is necessary in important matters to be particular). about a boa constrictor and refused to go back to sleep. quote: When the clock struck three, Elizabeth felt that she must go, and very unwillingly said so.

quote: A gambling fever swept through the sophomore class and they bent over the bones till three o‚Äôclock many a sultry night.

quote: According to her watch it was shortly after three o'clock, and according to everything else it was night-time.

timeString: three o' clock in the morning
quote: At three o' clock in the morning Eurydice is bound to come into it. quote: But at three o‚Äôclock in the morning, a forgotten package has the same tragic importance as a death sentence, and the cure doesn‚Äôt work -- and in a real dark night of the soul it is always three o‚Äôclock in the morning, day after day.

quote:

quote: When Sophie awoke, it was 3:00 a.m.

quote: "You hearken, Missy. It‚Äôs three o‚Äôclock in the morning and I‚Äôve got all my faculties as well as ever I had in my life. I know all my property and where the money‚Äôs put out. author: Terry Pratchett

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know why you think your life has been so bad,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúWe had a lot of fun when we were younger. Hey, do you remember the time when we went over the edge of the world?‚Äù

quote:
3.06 AM

title: Honor Among Thieves
author: Jeffrey Archer

quote: "Three minutes to four," she replied, consulting her broad old gold watch, and then holding it to her ear. "Yes, three minutes to four. I thought it was later. You saw something, William Maubray - you did. You have seen something, haven't you?"
title: All in the Dark
author: Joseph Sheridan Le Fanu

quote: The ancient house was deserted, the crumbling garage padlocked, and one was just able to discern - by peering through a crack in the bubbling sun on the window - the face of a clock on the opposite wall. The clock had stopped at two minutes to four early in the morning, or who could tell, it may have been earlier still, yesterday in the afternoon, a couple of hours after Kaiser had left Kamaria for Bartica.
title: Heartland
author: Wilson Harris

quote: The clock atop the clubhouse reads 3:58.
title: Underworld
author: Don DeLillo

quote: And the raw materials of reality without that glue of time are materials adrift and reality is as meaningless as the balsa parts of a model airplane scattered to the wind...I am in my old room, yes, in the dark, certainly, and it is cold, obviously, but what time is it? "Nearly four, son."
title: Sometimes a Great Notion
author: Ken Kesey

quote: He turned to Zor Ala. "You are to make such contacts with the other humans of the colony as you feel advisable, and you will organize several parties from those you feel you can trust. Have them gather in small groups on either side of the main gate, staying in the shadows of the stockade wall. Be sure they are ready at one minute to four. Have the members armed with any weapons you can devise."
title: The Time-Techs of Kra
author: Max Sheridan

quote: At four o'clock Mark sat in the Fairy's office rereading the last two articles he had written-one for the most respectable of our papers, the other for a more popular organ. This was the only part of the night's work which had anything in it to flatter literary vanity. The earlier hours had been spent in the sterner labor of concocting the news itself.
title: That Hideous Strength
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: She should have told him. It isn‚Äôt friendly, the fact that she hasn‚Äôt told him. The first time, she told him and they both cried, holding each other closely, consoling each other for some violation they felt as mutual. Then they discussed their problems, sitting up till four in the morning, whispering across the kitchen table.
title: Life Before Man
author: Margaret Atwood

quote:
I followed his gaze to the mantelpiece. The clock had stopped at four o‚Äôclock.
‚ÄúMon ami, someone has tampered with it. It had still three days to run. It is an eight-day clock, you comprehend?‚Äù
‚ÄúBut what should they want to do that for? Some idea of a false scent by making the crime appear to have taken place at four o‚Äôclock?‚Äù
title: The Big Four
author: Agatha Christie

quote: The cloud descended, and Bill‚Äôs voice was divorced from what transpired in his head. The purple cloud had a notion. It swept down on top of him like smoke billowing from fallen towers. The possibility that all his work and all his travels and all his passion was just farce. His way of coping at four a.m. on a West Texas Highway. His heart thundered, and he dreamt the Truth, but each discovery was a slippery as a fish in the hand, and every time he tried to catch one, it would simply wriggle its tail and be free.
title: Ohio
author: Stephen Markley

quote: It‚Äôs a delusional painter who finishes a canvas at two o‚Äôclock and expects radical societal transformation by four. Even when artists write manifestos, they are (hopefully) aware that their exigent tone is, finally, borrowed, only echoing and mimicking the urgency of the guerrilla‚Äôs demands, or the activist‚Äôs protests, rather than truly enacting it. The people sometimes demand change. They almost never demand art.
title: Intimations
author: Zadie Smith

quote: When the row of clocks in their cases chimed out four, he closed the ledger and reached out for the oil lamp on the edge of the counter. Removing the glass chimney, he struck a match and held it to the wick, then replaced the glass and watched the flame‚Äôs amber tones fill the room, scattering shadows between the clock faces.
title: Cogheart
author: Peter Bunzl

quote: All this is visible to you by the light of an oil lamp hanging from the ceiling, and by that of an excellent fire, near which I sit in my cloak and bonnet; my muff and umbrella lie on the table, and I am warming away the numbness and chill contracted by sixteen hours‚Äô exposure to the rawness of an October day: I left Lawton at four o‚Äôclock a.m. and the Millcote town clock is now just striking eight.
title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Bront√´

quote: It was four o‚Äôclock before we finally got away. Now, for some reason, it was Charles and Camilla who weren‚Äôt speaking. They‚Äôd fought about something - I‚Äôd seen them arguing in the yard - and all the way home, in the back seat, they sat side by side and stared straight ahead, their arms folded across their chests in what I am sure they did not realize was a comically identical fashion.
title: The Secret History
author: Donna Tartt

quote: After Francis left I fell asleep again. When I woke up it was four in the morning. I had slept for nearly twenty-four hours.
title: The Secret History
author: Donna Tartt

quote: He wakes up at four, and when he goes outside with the new gloves in one hand, Alice is sitting in the eternal motel lawn chair, bundled up in an I LOVE LAS VEGAS sweatshirt and looking up at a rind of moon.
title: Billy Summers
author: Stephen King

quote:
His mother knew about the no-talking thing. It had happened after Danny had ventured into Room 217 at the Overlook.
‚ÄúWill you talk to Dick?‚Äù
Lying in his bed, looking up at her, he nodded. His mother called, even though it was four in the morning.
Late the next day, Dick came. He brought something with him.
A present.
title: Doctor Sleep
author: Stephen King

quote:
As a sign of respect, Rose took off her tophat and held it by her side.
At four o‚Äôclock they trooped back to their encampment in the parking lot, invigorated. They would return the next day, and the day after that, and the day after that. They would return until the good steam was exhausted, and then they would move on.
title: Doctor Sleep
author: Stephen King

quote: Vera had been hanging by a thread for a week now, comatose, in and out of Cheyne-Stokes respiration, and this was exactly the sort of night the frail ones picked to go out on. Usually at 4 a.m.
title: Doctor Sleep
author: Stephen King

quote: A poet might die at at twenty-one, a revolutionary or a rock start at twenty-four. But after that you assume everything‚Äôs going to be all right. You‚Äôve made it past Dead Man‚Äôs Curve and you‚Äôre out of the tunnel, cruising straight for your destination down a six-lane highway‚Äîwhether you want to be or not. You get your hair cut; every morning you shave. You aren‚Äôt a poet anymore, or a revolutionary or a rock star. You don‚Äôt pass out drunk in phone booths or blast out the Doors at four in the morning.
title: Blind Willow, Sleeping Woman
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: Three months before the block party, before Oliver Dubois drove a stolen truck into his own living room, before somebody shot Step Volkin at Forty-Six Oak Drive, Holly Dubois decided on an early morning walk. Real early. Four A.M. early.
title: Behind the Lie
author: Emilya Naymark

quote: ‚ÄúBuster,‚Äù she whispered, rubbing the little shih tzu to wake him. After all, walking by herself at four in the morning might be considered wacky. Nobody did that in Sylvan except one or two dedicated runners during their cooldowns, and she wasn‚Äôt a runner.
title: Behind the Lie
author: Emilya Naymark

quote: Then I was lying half asleep in the cold lower level of the Pennsylvania Station, staring at the morning Tribune, and waiting for the four o‚Äôclock train.
title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: She lay down at four o‚Äôclock, not expecting to sleep a wink, but her healing body had its own priorities. She went under almost instantly, and when she woke to the insistent ùò•ùò¢ùò©-ùò•ùò¢ùò©-ùò•ùò¢ùò© of her bedside clock, she was glad she had set the alarm. Outside, a gusty October breeze was combing leaves from the trees and sending them across her backyard in colorful skitters. The light had gone that strange and depthless gold which seems the exclusive property of late-fall afternoons in New England.
title: Full Dark, No Stars
author: Stephen King

quote: ùòûùò©ùò¢ùòµ came in the form of a bright green van, Sunday morning, 4:00 A.M. sharp. Dervla awoke to acrid exhaust fumes billowing into her open bedroom window. Annoyance turned to gratitude when she spotted the peculiar vehicle, for Dervla knew a juicy bit of news when she saw one.
title: Pomegranate Soup
author: Marsha Mehran

quote: "Nothing happened," he said wanly. "I waited, and about four o'clock she came to the window and stood there for a minute and then turned out the light."
title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: "I looked at the clock and it was (yes, you guessed it) four am. I should have taken comfort from the fact that approximately quarter of the Greenwich Mean Time world had just jolted awake also and were lying, staring miserably into the darkness, worrying."
title: Watermelon
author: Marian Keyes

quote: Suddenly, he started to cry. Curled up on the sofa he sobbed loudly. Michel looked at his watch; it was just after 4 am. On the screen a wild cat had a rabbit in its mouth.
title: Atomised
author: Michel Houellebecq

quote:
The Birds begun at Four o'clock
Their period for Dawn
title: The Birds Begun at Four o'clock
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: The night before Albert Kessler arrived in Santa Teresa, at four in the morning, Sergio Gonzalez Rodriguez got a call from Azucena Esquivel Plata, reporter and PRI congresswoman.
author: Roberto Bolano

quote: Waking at four to soundless dark, I stare. In time the curtain-edges will grow light. Till then I see what's really always there: Unresting death, a whole day nearer now, Making all thought impossible but how And where and when I shall myself die.
title: Aubade
author: Philip Larkin

quote: When he noticed that the chefs from the grand hotels and restaurants - a picky, impatient bunch - tended to move around from seller to seller, buying apples here and broccoli there, he asked if he could have tea available for them. Tommy agreed, and the chefs, grateful for a hot drink at four in the morning, lingered and bought.
title: The Tea Rose
author: Jennifer Donnelly

quote: It was now four o‚Äôclock of a midsummer morning, and the western hills, that I could see through a hall window, began to be impurpled by reflection from the opposite horizon of the dawn.
title: The Hasheesh Eater
author: Fitz Hugh Ludlow

quote: Corporal Carrot awoke around four a.m., that secret hour known only to the night people, such as criminals, policemen and other misfits. He lay on his half of the narrow bed and stared at the wall.
title: Men at Arms
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: Twenty-seven people were got out of bed in quick succession and they got another fifty-three out of bed, because if there is one thing a man wants to know when he's woken up in a panic at 4:00 A.M., it's that he's not alone.
title: Good Omens
author: Terry Pratchett and Neil Gaiman

quote: In a moment I had the office and the night editor‚Äôs desk, had told him who I was, and began to dictate. ‚ÄúAt one minute past four by our time (see what time Paris time is for that, and put it in) a French battleship was sunk by the man who is to stop all war. Probably no one on board escaped.‚Äù That last was a guess based on the experience of the past.
title: The Man Who Ended War
author: Hollis Godfrey

quote: Charlie glanced at the clock. Barely past four a.m. at home. Sunday. She'd be up. Probably reading over a cup of coffee before taking a run before church.
title: Soldier On
author: Vanessa Rasanen

quote: Suddenly, he started to cry. Curled up on the sofa he sobbed loudly. Michel looked at his watch; it was just after 4 am. On the screen a wild cat had a rabbit in its mouth.
title: Atomised
author: Michel Houellebecq

quote: I walked up and down the row. No one gave me a second look. Finally I sat down next to a man. He paid no attention. My watch said 4:02. Maybe he was late.
title: The History of Love
author: Nicole Krauss

quote: It‚Äôs 4:03 a.m. on a supremely cold January morning and I‚Äôm just getting home. I‚Äôve been out dancing and I‚Äôm only half drunk but utterly exhausted.
title: The Time Traveler‚Äôs Wife
author: Audrey Niffenegger

quote: Four minutes after four! It's still very early and to get from here to there won't take me more than 15 minutes, even walking slowly. She told me around five o'clock. Wouldn't it be better to wait on the corner?
title: Angel Hill
author: Cirilo Villaverde

quote: Leaves were being blown against my window. It was 4.05 am. The moon had shifted in the sky, glaring through a clotted mass of clouds like a candled egg.
title: We Were the Mulvaneys
author: Joyce Carol Oates

quote: Dexter looked at Kate's note, then her face, then the clock. It was 4.06 am, the night before they would go to the restaurant.
title: The Expats
author: Chris Pavone

quote: 4.07 am. Why am I standing? My shoulders feel cold and I'm shivering. I become aware that I'm standing in the middle of the room. I immediately look at the bedroom door. Closed, with no signs of a break-in. Why did I get up?
title: Guarding Hanna: A Novel
author: Miha Mazzini

quote: It was at 4:08 a.m. beneath the cool metal of a jungle gym that all Andrew's dreams came true. He kissed his one true love and swore up and down that it would last forever to this exhausted companion throughout their long trek home.
title: Dying in the Twilight of Summer
author: Seth O'Connell

quote: ‚ÄúThe truck has driven nonstop through the night at a steady pace of around forty miles per hour in the direction of Baghdad, but at 4:09 this morning it turned off into the desert, and we ceased to monitor its movements, as that particular path leads nowhere.
title: Honor Among Thieves
author: Jeffrey Archer

quote: It was nine minutes past four. "He's sitting in the middle of an ultrasonic field and I'm ten minutes late to get him out. Come on!"
title: The Final Affair: A Man from U.N.C.L.E.
author: David McDaniel

quote:
"I don't like this waiting," he said.
She smiled. "You'd make a terrible PI."
"What time is it?"
"Four-ten. Fifteen minutes later than the last time you asked."
title: Copper River
author: William Kent Krueger

quote: The change came at four-ten. Lying on the sand, the woman in the black suit saw it coming and relaxed.
title: The Women
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: The next morning I awaken at exactly eleven minutes after four, having slept straight through my normal middle-of-the-night insomniac waking at three.
title: The Stuff of Life
author: Karen Karbo

quote: Finally, she signalled with her light that she'd made it to the top. I signalled back, then shined the light downward to see how far the water had risen. I couldn't make out a thing. My watch read four-twelve in the morning. Not yet dawn. The morning papers still not delivered, trains not yet running, citizens of the surface world fast asleep, oblivious to all this. I pulled the rope taut with both hands, took a deep breath, then slowly began my climb.
title: Hard-Boiled Wonderland and the End of the World
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: Karen felt the bed move beneath Harry's weight. Lying on her side she opened her eyes to see digital numbers in the dark, 4:12 in pale green. Behind her Harry continued to move, settling in. She watched the numbers change to 4:13.
title: Get Shorty
author: Elmore Leonard

quote: Karen felt the bed move beneath Harry's weight. Lying on her side she opened her eyes to see digital numbers in the dark, 4:12 in pale green. Behind her Harry continued to move, settling in. She watched the numbers change to 4:13.
title: Get Shorty
author: Elmore Leonard

quote: At 4:14 a.m., the two men returned to the Jeep. After the passenger replaced the cans in the back of the Jeep, the driver backed out of the driveway and headed east. The last images found on the film appeared to be flames or smoke.
title: A Real Nightmare
author: David H. Swendsen

quote: Alice wants to warn her that a defect runs in the family, like flat feet or diabetes: they're all in danger of ending up alone by their own stubborn choice. The ugly kitchen clock says four-fifteen.
title: Pigs in Heaven
author: Barbara Kingsolver

quote: I stooped to pick up my watch from the floor. Four-sixteen. Another hour until dawn. I went to the telephone and dialled my own number. It'd been a long time since I'd called home, so I had to struggle to remember the number. I let it ring fifteen times; no answer. I hung up, dialled again, and let it ring another fifteen times. Nobody.
title: Hard-Boiled Wonderland and the End of the World
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: They pulled into the visitor's carpark at four sixteen am. He knew it was four sixteen because the entrance to the maternity unit sported a digital clock beneath the signage.

author: Maree Anderson

quote: Big Al stretched and began to walk slowly around the car. He knew they planned to leave long before first light, which was at 6:48 A.M. He checked his watch: 4:17. They both looked up when a plane flew overhead, the first to land at Heathrow that morning.

author: Jeffrey Archer

quote: I succumbed to my curiosity, tugged up the left sleeve of my pullover, and checked my wristwatch. It was 4:17 a.m. This surprised me not because it was almost dawn, but because I‚Äôd had no idea of the time whatsoever.
title: The Catacombs
author: Jeremy Bates

quote: He awoke at 4.17 am in a sweat. He had been dreaming of Africa again, and then the dream had continued in the U.S. when he was a young man. But Inbata had been there, watching him.

author: Douglas Phinney

quote: I grabbed the alarm clock, threw it on my lap, and slapped the red and black buttons with both hands. The ringing didn't stop. The telephone! The clock read four-eighteen. It was dark outside. Four-eighteen a.m. I got out of bed and picked up the receiver. "Hello?"

author: Haruki Murakami

quote: At nineteen minutes past four on the morning of December 27, 2040, her eyes, dark as an Aztec sacrificial knife, flicked open.

author: James Axler

quote: At each waking he switched on the light and glanced at his bedside clock, hoping to find that dawn was near to breaking. Two-ten, three-forty, four-twenty.
title: The Lighthouse
author: P.D. James

quote: At twenty-one past four I inferred that the initial hostilities had not damaged its works. It was running, and I didn't know whether to interpret this indifference on the part of Time as a good or bad omen.
title: The Tin Drum
author: G√ºnter Grass

quote: The chairman dialed seven digits and asked to speak to the duty officer. He checked his watch as he waited to be put through. It was 4:22.
title: Honor Among Thieves
author: Jeffrey Archer

quote: He hurt me to the point where I wanted to tell him something. My watch said 4.22 now. It had stopped. It was smashed.
title: The Ipcress File
author: Len Deighton

quote: 4:23, Monday morning, Iceland Square. A number of people in the vicinity of Bjornsongatan are awakened by loud screams.
title: Let the Right One In
author: John Ajvide Lindqvist

quote: Her chip pulsed the time. 04:23:04. It had been a long day.
title: Neuromancer
author: William Gibson

quote: At 04:24 on January 5, 2025, the stars stood still in the sky. In California, the earthquake started with a low-frequency rumble. It wasn't a sound but a sensation that caused an incomprehensible weakness in the legs, a constriction of the bowels, and panic.

author: Carlos J. Cortes

quote: As I dressed I glanced at my watch. It was no wonder that no one was stirring. It was twenty-five minutes past four.

author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

quote: At twenty-six minutes past four, she was pronounced dead. Cause of death, or rather manner of death, was apparent. There were two bullet wounds of entry in her chest.

author: Ann Rule

quote: And then I heard the school bell in my dream but it wasn't really a school bell and the pitch went very steep like a trap door opening and I fell and landed in my bed. It was still dark and my alarm clock said 04:27 and I heard the noise again.
title: The Dead Fathers Club
author: Matt Haig

quote: He had been the only survivor - the only one who'd come home alive. So what the hell was going on? Who was this new character in his nightmares? He glanced up at the clock and was disheartened to discover that it was only 0428 hours.

author: Glenn Smith

quote:
"Your pardon, Dr. Leving, but there is an urgent call for you. The pseudo-robot Caliban says he must speak with you at once."
Fredda sighed. She knew she had to take the call, and that Caliban would only call if it were important. But even so, it was turning into a very long night.
"Now what time is it?" she asked.
"It is now 0429 hours," Donald said.
title: Utopia
author: Roger MacBride Allen

quote:
He cannot leave.
Most likely, he‚Äôll never leave.
Bram finds his way back to the chair and settles in.
Outside, a bird cries out as the moon comes and goes behind thick clouds. He retrieves the pocket watch from his coat and curses. He forgot to wind it, and the hands ceased their journey at 4:30. He stuffs it back into his pocket.
title: Dracul
author: Dacre Stoker & J.D. Barker

quote: What has happened to me? Why am I so alone in the world? 4:30 A.M.‚ÄîThe solution came to me, just as I was dozing off. Illuminated! Everything fits together, and I see what I should have known from the beginning. No more sleep. I‚Äôve got to get back to the lab and test this against the results from the computer. This, finally, is the flaw in the experiment. I‚Äôve found it.
title: Flowers for Algernon
author: Daniel Keyes

quote: Algernon died two days ago. I found him at four thirty in the morning when I came back to the lab after wandering around down at the waterfront‚Äîon his side, stretched out in the corner of his cage. As if he were running in his sleep.
title: Flowers for Algernon
author: Daniel Keyes

quote: Jonas rolls painfully out of the hammock, his aching lower back stiff and swollen, in desperate need of a chiropractor. He checks his watch. Four thirty‚Ä¶but is it a.m. or p.m.?

author: Steve Alten

quote:

author: David Mitchell

quote:
‚ÄúWhat time is it? Do you have time here?‚Äù
‚ÄúOf course we do.‚Äù She pulled up her sleeve, revealing a yellow Timex wristwatch. ‚ÄúIt is four thirty in the morning.‚Äù
‚ÄúThat‚Äôs a nice watch.‚Äù
‚ÄúMy father gave it to me,‚Äù she said happily.
title: The Catacombs
author: Jeremy Bates

quote: At the end of a relationship, it is the one who is not in love who makes the tender speeches. I was overwhelmed by a sense of betrayal, betrayal because a union in which I had invested so much had been declared bankrupt without my feeling it to be so. Chloe had not given it a chance, I argued with myself, knowing the hopelessness of these inner courts announcing hollow verdicts at four thirty in the morning.
title: Essays on Love
author: Alain de Botton

quote: Hester Thrale undulates in in a false fox jacket at 2330 as usual even though she has to be up at like 0430 for the breakfast shift at the Provident Nursing Home and sometimes eats breakfast with Gately, both their faces nodding perilously close to their Frosted Flakes.
title: Infinite Jest
author: David Foster Wallace

quote: As Miss Nichol walked along the corridor, she checked her watch. It was 4:31 A.M. She took the stairs down to the fifth floor and made her way to the nursery.
title: Sons of Fortune
author: Jeffrey Archer

quote: An earthquake hit Los Angeles at 4:31 this morning and the images began arriving via CNN right away.
title: Microserfs
author: Douglas Coupland

quote: On his first day of kindergarten, Peter Houghton woke up at 4:32 a.m. He padded into his parents' room and asked if it was time yet to take the school bus.
title: Nineteen Minutes
author: Jodi Picoult

quote: When he heard the faint clunk of a steel gate closing behind them, he smiled in the darkness. They were out. He pressed a button on the watch and when the light showed him it was 04.33 his smile became a grin. No one had made it out of Greenacres for over a decade, which made Bishop's achievement that much sweeter. That was the kind of record he liked to beat.

author: Jason Dean

quote: He was not pleased about being pulled out of his dream. The clock taunted him, saying it was 4:34 AM. He picked up the receiver.
title: Warrior Monk
author: Ray Keating

quote: With a heavy sigh, I pried open my eyes just enough to focus on the numbers glowing atop my nightstand. It was 4:34 A.M. What kind of sadist called another human being at 4:34 in the morning?

author: Darynda Jones

quote: No manner of exhaustion can keep a child asleep much later than six a.m. on Christmas Day. Colby awoke at 4:35.
title: Dreams and Shadows
author: C. Robert Cargill

quote: At 4:36 that morning, alone in my hotel room, it had been a much better scene. Spencer had blanched, confounded by the inescapable logic of my accusation. A few drops of perspiration had formed on his upper lip. A tiny vein had started to throb in his temple.
title: The Brass Go-Between
author: Ross Thomas

quote: The knock at the door was soft, but it still awoke Stephen. He touched the screen on his smartphone. 4:37 AM
title: Under the Golden Dome
author: Ray Keating

quote: Her bedroom was hardly any bigger than her king-size mattress, which she‚Äôd told me she‚Äôd inherited from her parents when her mother got sick ‚Äúand so they got two doubles because my dad couldn‚Äôt sleep at night with all her fidgeting.‚Äù Green numbers on a digital alarm clock glowed between cans of Diet 7UP on the bedside table. It was 4:37. I smelled peanut butter and again, the bitter tang of vomit.
title: My Year of Rest and Relaxation
author: Ottessa Moshfegh

quote: At 4.38 a.m. as the sun is coming up over Gorley Woods, I hear a strange rustling in the grass beside me. I peer closely but can see nothing.
title: The Queue
author: Jonathan Barrow

quote: At zero hour minus one minute, twenty-one minutes to five on March the twenty-first, Jiffy Tripp stood in the tranches beside an infantry officer, looking over no man's land. It was still dark. At zero hour plus five seconds the shell bursts actually threw a sort of witch's kaleidoscope onto no man's land, and he was reaching for the SOS rockets. Red - green - red.

author: Phillip Child

quote: I settled into a daily routine. Wake up at 4.40 am, shower, get on the train north by ten after five.
title: Bossypants
author: Tina Fey

quote: At 4:41 Crane's voice crackled through the walkie-talkie as if he'd read their thoughts of mutiny. ‚ÄúEveryone into the elevator. Now!‚Äù Only moments before the call he and C.J. had finished what they hoped would be a successful diversion.
title: Damaged Goods: A Novel
author: Roland S. Jefferson

quote: A large clock above the desks read 04:42 am. He paused to listen. Whatever had happened there, appeared to be over.

author: Matthew Warwick

quote: The time is four forty-three in the mornin an it's almost light oot there.
title: Pyschoraag
author: Suhayl Saadi

quote: "At 0444 hours yesterday morning, the landing craft Orpheus was appropriated by Dr. Diana Chandler, twenty-seven, an astrophysicist from Toronto, Canada. Dr. Chandler, apparently disconsolate over the failure of her husband, Aaron Rossman, also twenty-seven, also of Toronto, to renew their recently expired two-year marriage contract, presumably committed suicide. Mr. Rossman is the Starcology's dock master."
title: Golden Fleece
author: Robert J. Sawyer

quote: He never found it necessary to phone the Prime Minister, although Mr. Churchill did phone him on one occasion. It was four forty-five in the morning when Charlie picked up the receiver on his desk.
title: As the Crow Flies
author: Jeffrey Archer

quote: His wife's breathing at his side is so faint that he can scarcely hear it. One of these mornings she'll be lying dead beside me and I won't even notice, he thinks. Or maybe it'll be me. Daybreak will reveal that one of us has been left alone. He checks the clock on the table next to the bed. The hands glow and register 4:45 a.m.
title: Faceless Killers
author: Henning Mankell

quote:
The phone rang again at four-forty-six.
"Hello," I said.
"Hello," came a woman's voice. "Sorry about the time before. There's a disturbance in the sound field. Sometimes the sound goes away."
"The sound goes away?"
"Yes," she said. "The sound field's slipping. Can you hear me?"
title: Hard-Boiled Wonderland and the End of the World
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: I slept only fitfully after looking online. The phrases I‚Äôd read repeated in my head over and over again. When I woke up for what felt like the hundredth time, the Stormtrooper clock beside the bed read 4.47 am.
title: What She Knew
author: Gilly MacMillan

quote: At 4:48 the happy hour when clarity visits warm darkness which soaks my eyes I know no sin
title: 4:48 Psychosis
author: Sarah Kane

quote: Thinking about the card warms me to the idea of walking under the arched doorway of the Newtons' home, but when I arrive at their house, the plan seems ridiculous. What am I doing? It's 4:48 a.m., and I'm parked outside their darkened house.
title: What is the What
author: Dave Eggers

quote: When Costain left the bridge the brass chromometer in the wheelhouse said eleven minutes to five. Harkness looked at it and realised vaguely that the gap was still too big.
title: Gale Force
author: Elleston Trevor

quote: Even the hands of his watch and the hands of all the thirteen clocks were frozen. They had all frozen at the same time, on a snowy night, seven years before, and after that it was always ten minutes to five in the castle.
title: The 13 Clocks
author: James Thurber

quote:
4:51 A.M.
"You know, I hate to spoil all the fun you're having." Vance tried to look at Moreau, but he could barely see through the swelling of his puffy eyelids. "But I've got some unsettling news. You and the rest of Ramirez's hoods are about to be in a deep situation here. The minute you try to send that bomb up, you can tip your hat and kiss your ass good-bye. Better enjoy this while you can."
title: Project Cyclops
author: Thomas Hoover

quote:
"Earlier? It's nine minutes to five a.m. - who would be up this early?"
"Oh, we're all early risers."
title: Gifts of the Magi
author: Jean Johnson

quote: Anna left the apartment at 4:52 A.M., dressed in jeans, a blue T-shirt, a linen jacket, and a baseball cap. She wasn‚Äôt sure what to expect as she stepped out onto the sidewalk that cool, dark morning.
title: False Impression
author: Jeffrey Archer

quote: "If it matters, it's eight minutes to five. Don't get any persecuted ideas that I enjoy being out of bed at this time of night. It makes it legally easier if you invite us in."
title: Holding the Zero
author: Gerald Seymour

quote: It was so quiet in the post office that Trinidad could hear the soft tick of the clock's second hand every time it moved. It was now seven minutes before five.
title: The Silence of Bonaventure Arrow
author: Rita Leganski

quote: When the last lid had been placed back on he checked the clock on the wall: six minutes to five. Just enough time to glance in the other box and see if he could expect the same again.
title: A Matter of Honor
author: Jeffrey Archer

quote: Six minutes to five. Six minutes to go. Suddenly I felt quite clearheaded. There was an unexpected light in the cell; the boundaries were drawn, the roles well defined. The time of doubt and questioning and uncertainty was over.
title: Dawn: A Novel
author: Elie Wiesel

quote:
There were two messages. The first, sent at 4:55 a.m., was from the campus garage.
"We have your vehicle," the mechanic's voice informed him. "Unfortunately, we had some trouble getting it out of the ditch, and it has sustained a small amount of additional damage."
title: The Enclave
author: Karen Hancock

quote:
4:55 - Mank holding phone. Turns to Caddell - "Who is this?"
Caddell: "Jim." (shrugs) "I think he's our man in Cincinnati."
title: Fear and Loathing: On the Campaign Trail '72
author: Hunter S. Thompson

quote:
Trying to identify the key facts, Ethan was suddenly aware he was looking at the wall clock; it was 7:35.
‚ÄúWait a minute. When did you hear about this?‚Äù
There was a tiny moment of hesitation. ‚ÄúThe first news came in just before five.‚Äù
title: The Infinite Day
author: Chris Walley

quote:
‚ÄúThat's it. At four minutes to five by yours. Seven to, by mine.‚Äù
It was the cuirassier who remained by the side of General D'Hubert, keeping his one eye fixed immovably on the white face of the watch he held in the palm of his hand. He opened his mouth wide, waiting for the beat of the last second, long before he snapped out the word:
‚ÄúAvancez!‚Äù
title: The Point of Honor
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: One hundred and thirty-one seconds were lost at Elkhart in changing locomotives, and it was three minutes to five when big 599, with Dave Luce in the cab, turned her nose toward the dawning day and started for Toledo, 133 miles away.
title: Careers of Danger and Daring
author: Cleveland Moffett

quote: It was not until they had swept through the village, over the bridge, and were out on the broad highway toward Chester that Ruth began to realize what a wild goose chase she had undertaken. Just where did she expect to find them, anyway? It was now three minutes to five by the little clock in the car and it was a full fifteen minutes' drive to Chester.
title: The Search
author: Grace Livingston Hill

quote: The second said the same thing a few minutes before five, and mentioned eternity... I'm sure I'll meet you in the other world. Four minutes later she left a last, fleeting message: My love. Fernando. It's Suzana. Then, it seemed, she had shot herself.
title: A Death in Brazil: A Book of Omissions
author: Peter Robb

quote: He wants to look death in the face. Two minutes to five. I took a handkerchief out of my pocket, but John Dawson ordered me to put it back. An Englishman dies with his eyes open. He wants to look death in the face.
title: Dawn: A Novel
author: Elie Wiesel

quote: The captain and his three mates appeared out of the early morning mist at one minute to five. All four of them were dressed in exactly the same clothes they had been wearing the night before, making Percy wonder if they‚Äôd come straight from the Fisherman‚Äôs Arms.
title: The Undiplomatic Diplomat
author: Jeffrey Archer

quote: The whole place smells like death no matter what the fuck you do. Gately gets to the shelter at 0459.9h and just shuts his head off as if his head had a control switch.
title: Infinite Jest
author: David Foster Wallace

quote: At precisely 5 o‚Äôclock, like every morning, hours before a single stirring would emerge from the rooms upstairs, Dora dragged herself from her bed and made her way down the hallway to the kitchen, where she put on a kettle and dropped a bag of Earl Grey in a mug.
title: When the Summer Was Ours
author: Roxanne Veletzos

quote:
‚ÄúI just took all the pills in the bathroom cabinet,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúSixty-two aspirin with codeine, twenty-four Valiums. I thought you might like to say goodbye.‚Äù
‚ÄúThat was stupid, Martha,‚Äù Nate says. ‚ÄúDid you really?‚Äù
‚ÄúWait and see,‚Äù she says, laughing. ‚ÄúWait till five in the morning when you get to inspect the body.‚Äù
title: Life Before Man
author: Margaret Atwood

quote: Soft yellow light came through the side windows. It was morning: he had slept the whole night! He looked quickly at his watch: 5:00 A.M. Still almost six hours to go before the boat had to be recalled.
title: Jurassic Park
author: Michael Crichton

quote:
Muldoon scowled. ‚ÄúThe electrified fences were off?‚Äù
‚ÄúYes.‚Äù
‚ÄúAll of them? Since five this morning? For the last five hours?‚Äù
‚ÄúYes.‚Äù
title: Jurassic Park
author: Michael Crichton

quote: THE HAMMER BANGED reveille on the rail outside camp HQ at five o‚Äôclock as always. Time to get up. The ragged noise was muffled by ice two fingers thick on the windows and soon died away. Too cold for the warder to go on hammering.
title: One Day in the Life of Ivan Denosovich
author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

quote: "According to Leon ‚Ä¶ the day after tomorrow. The attack is scheduled for the day after tomorrow at about five o‚Äôclock in the morning." His face was still in shadow.

author: Jodi Taylor

quote:
Sixsmith,
Sitting at my escritoire in my dressing gown. The church bell chimes five. Another thirsty dawn. My candle is burnt away. A tiring night turned inside out.
title: Cloud Atlas
author: David Mitchell

quote: Five o‚Äôclock had hardly struck on the morning of the nineteenth of January, when Bessie brought a candle into my closet and found me already up and nearly dressed.
title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Bront√´

quote: They had been up since five o‚Äôclock that morning, as the reader will remember; but bah! there is no such thing as fatigue on Sunday, said Favourite; on Sunday fatigue does not work.
title: Les Mis√©rables
author: Victor Hugo

quote:
My grandfather Arthur once took me fishing. I was seven.
I suppose he must have gone fishing frequently, although I never recall him bringing back any fish, nor indeed, any other fishing trips.
He woke me up at five, before the sun was up.
title: The Comical Tragedy or Tragical Comedy of Mr. Punch
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: Thursday morning. The day of. Billy gets up at five. He eats toast with a glass of water to wash it down. No coffee. No caffeine of any kind until the job is done. When he shoulders the 700 and looks through the Leupold scope, he wants his hands perfectly steady.
title: Billy Summers
author: Stephen King

quote:
Not even a yawn. I wasn‚Äôt remotely sleepy. I could tell my sense of balance was off‚ÄîI nearly fell over when I tried to stand up, but I pushed through it and tidied up for a while, sliding the videocassettes into their cases and putting them back on the shelf. I thought some activity might tire me out. I took a Zyprexa and some more Ativan. I ate a handful of melatonin, chewing like a cow on cud. Nothing was working.
So I called Trevor.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs five in the morning,‚Äù he said. He sounded irritated and foggy, but he‚Äôd answered.
title: My Year of Rest and Relaxation
author: Ottessa Moshfegh

quote:
Sixsmith,
Shot myself through the roof of my mouth at five A.M. this morning with V.A.‚Äòs Luger. But I saw you, my dear, dear fellow! How touched I am that you care so much! On the belfry‚Äôs lookout, yesterday, at sunset. Sheerest fluke you didn‚Äôt see me first.
title: Cloud Atlas
author: David Mitchell

quote: I did Dani√®le‚Äôs math in my head. ‚ÄúIf we start at ten, walk for four hours, rest for one, walk for another two, that‚Äôs seven hours in total. That will take us to five in the morning. Seven hours back, it won‚Äôt be noon until we resurface.‚Äù
title: The Catacombs
author: Jeremy Bates

quote:
The unlocked back door creaked open slowly to reveal Fiona Athey, with an apologetic look on her face, She was holding a stack of flyers under her left arm. ‚ÄúI hope I didn‚Äôt wake you up, now. I‚Äôll come back another time, then. Sorry.‚Äù She turned to leave.
‚ÄúNo, stay,‚Äù Marjan replied. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been up since five. Making a new batch of bread. Why don‚Äôt you come in for a cup of tea?‚Äù
title: Pomegranate Soup
author: Marsha Mehran

quote: Soon after 5 a.m. he noticed the sky at its edges beginning to turn an oyster grey. Gradually the dark crests of the wooded pine hills emerged, serrated like a saw‚Äôs teeth against the spreading light, while in the valleys the white mist seemed as solid as a glacier.
title: Munich
author: Robert Harris

quote: It was in the township of Dunwich, in a large and hardly inhabited farmhouse set against a hillside 4 miles from the village and a mile and a half from any other dwelling, that Wilbur Whately was born at 5 a.m. on Sunday, 2 February, 1913. The date was recalled because it was Candlemas, which people in Dunwich curiously observe under another name.
title: The Dunwich Horror
author: H.P. Lovecraft

quote: Just after five o'clock on this chill September morning, the fishmonger's cart, containing Kirsten and Emilia and such possessions as they have been able to assemble in the time allowed to them, is driven out of the gates of Rosenborg?
title: Music and Silence
author: Rose Tremain

quote: The cold eye of the Duke was dazzled by the gleaming of a thousand jewels that sparkled on the table. His ears were filled with chiming as the clocks began to strike. "One!" said Hark. "Two!" cried Zorn of Zorna. "Three!" the Duke's voice almost whispered. "Four!" sighed Saralinda. "Five!" the Golux crowed, and pointed at the table. "The task is done, the terms are met," he said."
title: The 13 Clocks
author: James Thurber

quote: The day came slow, till five o'clock. Then sprang before the hills. Like hindered rubies, or the light. A sudden musket spills
title: The Day Came Slow, Till Five O' Clock
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: There are worse things than having behaved foolishly in public. There are worse things than these miniature betrayals, committed or endured or suspected; there are worse things than not being able to sleep for thinking about them. It is 5 a.m. All the worse things come stalking in and stand icily about the bed looking worse and worse and worse.

author: Fleur Adcock

quote: What causes young people to "come out," but the noble ambition of matrimony? What sends them trooping to watering-places? What keeps them dancing till five o'clock in the morning through a whole mortal season?

author: William Makepeace Thackeray

quote: Any watcher trained in reading body language would have been prepared to bet that, after the click, someone was going to suggest that they might as well go somewhere and have a few drinks, and then someone else would fancy a meal, and then there was always room for a few more drinks, and then it would be 5 a.m. and the city guards would be respectfully knocking on the University gates and asking if the Archchancellor would care to step down to the cells to identify some alleged wizards who were singing an obscene song in six-part harmony, and perhaps he would also care to bring some money to pay for all the damage.
title: Moving Pictures
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: The rain was a solid curtain when he finally staggered out into the gray light of dawn. The gutters overflowed. Along the rooftops, repulsive gargoyles threw up expertly over passers-by although, since it was now five a.m., the crowds had thinned out a bit.

author: Terry Pratchett

quote: "Oh yes. His clocks were set at one minute past five, four minutes past five and seven minutes past five. That was the combination number of a safe, 515457. The safe was concealed behind a reproduction of the Mona Lisa. Inside the safe," continued Poirot, with distaste, "were the Crown Jewels of the Russian Royal Family."
title: The Clocks
author: Agatha Christie

quote: Just after five o'clock on this chill September morning, the fishmonger's cart, containing Kirsten and Emilia and such possessions as they have been able to assemble in the time allowed to them, is driven out of the gates of Rosenborg?
title: Music and Silence
author: Rose Tremain

quote: It was 5:02 a.m., December 14. In another fifty-eight minutes he would set sail for America. He did not want to leave his bride; he did not want to go.
title: The Prize
author: Brenda Joyce

quote: It was 5:03 a.m. It didn't matter. She wasn't going to get back to sleep. She threw off her covers and, swearing at herself, Caleb and Mr. Griffin, she headed into the shower.

author: Heather Graham

quote: I looked down at the watch Trey had given me last Christmas, the delicate gold links so real and solid, and it seemed like someone else‚Äôs memory strapped to someone else‚Äôs shaking hand. It was 5:03 now. I was halfway to my house.
title: Mother May I
author: Joshilyn Jackson

quote: "Oh yes. His clocks were set at one minute past five, four minutes past five and seven minutes past five. That was the combination number of a safe, 515457. The safe was concealed behind a reproduction of the Mona Lisa. Inside the safe," continued Poirot, with distaste, "were the Crown Jewels of the Russian Royal Family."
title: The Clocks
author: Agatha Christie

quote: 5.04 a.m. on the substandard clock radio. Because why do people always say the day starts now? Really it starts in the middle of the night at a fraction of a second past midnight.
title: The Accidental
author: Ali Smith

quote: The baby, a boy, is born at five past five in the morning.
title: The Namesake
author: Jhumpa Lahiri

quote: 5:06 a.m. I wake up strangely energized, my stomach growling. Upstairs, the overstocked fridge offers me its bounty of sympathy food.

author: Jonathon Tropper

quote: He blinked, turned over, and stared at the fluorescent green figures on his bedside clock: 5:07. More than enough time to go over the opening lines in his mind before getting up.

author: Jeffrey Archer

quote:
‚ÄòWas the time of that call recorded?‚Äô demanded the Hawk.
‚ÄòYes, sir. At 5.07. I called back just after nine and told Dr Redwood he could visit his patient in the prison hospital at his convenience, and carry out a full examination. He did so later that morning.‚Äô
title: Next in Line
author: Jeffrey Archer

quote: "Oh yes. His clocks were set at one minute past five, four minutes past five and seven minutes past five. That was the combination number of a safe, 515457. The safe was concealed behind a reproduction of the Mona Lisa. Inside the safe," continued Poirot, with distaste, "were the Crown Jewels of the Russian Royal Family."
title: The Clocks
author: Agatha Christie

quote: Ambrose and I will marry at Fort McHenry at 5:08 EDST this coming Saturday, Rosh Hashanah!

author: John Barth

quote: ‚ÄúYou‚Äôll have one by the side of your bed in a few years‚Äô time, so you wouldn‚Äôt even need to go into your office,‚Äù said Su Ling, letting her head fall back on the pillow when she saw 5:09 flick up on the bedside clock.
title: Sons of Fortune
author: Jeffrey Archer

quote: The primal flush of triumph which had saturated the American's humor on this signal success, proved but fictive and transitory when inquiry of the station attendants educed the information that the two earliest trains to be obtained were the 5:09 to Dunkerque and the 5:37 for Ostend.

author: Louis Joseph Vance

quote: "Oh, my husband, I have done the deed which will relieve you of the wife whom you hate! I have taken the poison--all of it that was left in the paper packet, which was the first that I found. If this is not enough to kill me, I have more left in the bottle. Ten minutes past five."

author: Wilkie Collins

quote: I settled into a daily routine. Wake up at 4:40 am, shower, get on the train north by ten after five.
title: Bossypants
author: Tina Fey

quote: Today was Tuesday, the fifteenth of August; the sun had risen at eleven minutes past five this morning and would set at two minutes before seven this evening.
title: The Hot Rock
author: Donald E Westlake

timeString: twelve minutes and six seconds past five o'clock
quote: At twelve minutes and six seconds past five o'clock on the morning of April 18th, 1906, the San Francisco peninsula began to shiver in the grip of an earthquake which, when its ultimate consequences are considered, was the most disastrous in the recorded history of the North American continent.
title: Slummer's Paradise
author: Herbert Asbury

quote: Wu said, ‚ÄúYou shut down at five-thirteen this morning, and when you started back up, you started with auxiliary power.‚Äù
title: Jurassic Park
author: Michael Crichton

quote: Lying on my side in bed, I stared at my alarm clock until it became a blemish, its red hue glowing like a welcome sign beckoning me into the depths of hell's crimson-colored cavities. 5:13 am. To describe this Monday as a blue Monday was an understatement.

author: Nakia D Johnson

quote: The time was 5.14 am, a very strange time indeed for the sheriff to have seen what he claimed he saw as he made his early-morning rounds, first patrolling back and forth along the deserted, snowbound streets of Kingdom City before extending his vigilance northward, along County Road.

author: Thomas H. Cook

quote: By the first week of May, Ralph was waking up to birdsong at 5:15 a.m. He tried earplugs for a few nights, although he doubted from the outset that they would work. It wasn‚Äôt the newly returned birds that were waking him up, nor the occasional delivery-truck backfire out on Harris Avenue. He had always been the sort of guy who could sleep in the middle of a brass marching bad, and he didn‚Äôt think that had changed. What had changed was inside his head.

author: Stephen King

quote: Weird conversation with Brown, a tired & confused old man who's been jerked out of bed at 5:15.
title: Fear and Loathing: On the Campaign Trail '72
author: Hunter S Thompson

quote: 5:16 - Mank on phone to Secretary of State Brown: 'Mr. Brown, we're profoundly disturbed about this situation in the 21st. We can't get a single result out of there.
title: Fear and Loathing: On the Campaign Trail '72
author: Hunter S Thompson

quote: She could go back to sleep. But typical and ironic, she is completely awake. It is completely light outside now; you can see for miles. Except there is nothing to see here; trees and fields and that kind of thing. 5:16 a.m on the substandard clock radio. She is really awake.

author: Ali Smith

quote:
After managing to get roughly three hours of sleep, Grant checked the time on his phone. 5:17 AM.
More sleep is unlikely. Time for a morning run.

author: Ray Keating

quote: WILLIAM PICKED UP THE PHONE but didn‚Äôt turn on the light as the digital clock on his bedside table turned from 5:17 to 5:18. He knew it could only be one person on the other end of the line.

author: Jeffrey Archer

quote: The story is there, and the security photo that runs with it is pretty damning. An hour earlier the light wouldn‚Äôt have been good enough to show the doer‚Äôs face, but the time stamp on the bottom of the photo is 5:18 AM. The sun isn‚Äôt up but it‚Äôs getting there, and the face of the guy standing in the alley is as clear as you‚Äôd want, if you were a prosecutor.

quote:
ABOARD TPA 545
5:18 A.M.
Emily Jansen sighed in relief. The long flight was nearing an end. Morning sunlight streamed through the windows of the airplane.

author: Michael Crichton

quote: Scott eased himself into the corner before once again checking the little sulphur dots on his watch. It was 5:19. He and Hannah had been in the safe for an hour and seventeen minutes.

author: Jeffrey Archer

quote:
5:19 A.M.
She heaved a sigh of relief as she put down the microphone and prepared to stumble down the hill. She realized she had violated protocol by breaking radio silence, but she was almost as worried about Michael Vance as she was about the facility.

author: Thomas Hoover

quote: If she can keep her speed to seventy until she leaves the turnpike at midtown, and if she catches most of the traffic lights, she estimates she can be at her building by five-twenty.

author: Stephen King

quote: He saw on the floor his cigarette reduced to a long thin cylinder of ash: it had smoked itself. It was five twenty, dawn was breaking behind the shed of empty barrels, the thermometer pointed to 210 degrees.

author: Primo Levi

timeString: twenty-one minutes past five o'clock in the morning
quote: On the morning of the ninth instant, that is to say, yesterday, at twenty-one minutes past five o'clock in the morning, P.C. Whitstable was proceeding upon his usual beat and had reached the corner of Clarges Street and Piccadilly, when he heard a shout on the other side of the road, at the point where a path exits from The Green Park.

quote: "Yes," she nodded. "I will take off in the dark, and be over Tuti airfield at sunrise. That's at 05.22 hours."
title: The Leopard Hunts in Darkness
author: Wilbur Smith

quote: Tock wagged his tail proudly, but Milo didn‚Äôt say a word, and to this day no one knows of the lost week but the few people who happened to be awake at 5:23 on that very strange morning.
title: The Phantom Tollbooth
author: Norton Juster

quote: If I could count precisely to sixty between two passing orange minutes on her digital clock, starting at 5:23 am and ending exactly as it melted into 5:24, then when she woke she would love me and not say this had been a terrible mistake.
title: The Tragedy of Arthur
author: Arthur Phillips

quote: If I could count precisely to sixty between two passing orange minutes on her digital clock, starting at 5:23 am and ending exactly as it melted into 5:24, then when she woke she would love me and not say this had been a terrible mistake.
title: The Tragedy of Arthur
author: Arthur Phillips

quote: At 5:25 a.m. the doorbell rings, always an evil omen. I stagger to the intercom and push the button.
title: The Time Traveler‚Äôs Wife
author: Audrey Niffenegger

quote: George's train home from New Street leaves at 5.25. On the return journey, there are rarely schoolboys.
title: Arthur and George
author: Julian Barnes

quote: I think this is actually bump number 1,970. And the boy keeps plugging away at the same speed. There isn‚Äôt a sound from them. Not a moan. Poor them. Poor me. I look at the clock. 05:26.
title: 101 Reykjavik
author: Hallgr√≠mur Helgason

quote: She looked at her watch. It was 5.27 am. Surely Gawain would already be here? Wouldn‚Äôt he be looking out for her, since there was no obvious way of getting inside?

author: Carmen Reid

quote: I pulled into the Aoyama supermarket parking garage at five-twenty-eight. The sky to the east was getting light. I entered the store carrying my bag. Almost no one was in the place. A young clerk in a striped uniform sat reading a magazine; a woman of indeterminate age was buying a cartload of cans and instant food. I turned past the liquor display and went straight to the snack bar.

author: Haruki Murakami

quote:

Darkness again.
Orme groped his way to the door and tugged at the handle. The door would not open; built with air-tight nicety, it did not budge in the least.

author: Bannister Merwin

quote: Shortly before five-thirty Father Martin woke himself with a shriek of terror. He jerked up in bed and sat, rigid as a doll, staring wild-eyed into the darkness.
title: Death in Holy Orders
author: P.D. James

quote: ‚ÄúWhen they pulled out of the driveway at five thirty in the morning, Emmett was in good spirits. The night before, with the help of Billy‚Äùs map, he had laid out an itinerary. The route form Morgen to San Francisco was a little over fifteen hundred miles."
title: The Lincoln Highway
author: Amor Towles

quote: He picks her up, places her on the bed, lies down beside her. He kisses her again, tentatively, lingeringly. Then he asks what time it is. He himself has no watch. Lesje tells him it‚Äôs five-thirty. He sits up. Lesje is beginning to feel slightly unattractive. Are her teeth too large, is that it?
title: Life Before Man
author: Margaret Atwood

quote: It was half-past five before Holmes returned. He was bright, eager, and in excellent spirits, a mood which in his case alternated with fits of the blackest depression.

author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

quote: Harry awoke at half past five the next morning as abruptly and completely as if somebody had yelled in his ear.

author: J.K. Rowling

quote: Had Thomas McGuire stopped to admire the fanfare of saffron rays, he might have missed the beginning of the end of his rule over the sleepy seaside town. The obstinate businessman had charged out of his hard bed at five-thirty that morning, determined as ever to tend to his growing empire of three pubs, two spirit shops, and one inn on Main Mall.

quote: Quiet as I am, I become at Eleven o'Clock in the Morning on every day of the week save Sunday a raving, ranting maniac -- a dangerous lunatic, panting with insane desires to do, not only myself but other people, a mischief, and possessed less by hallucination than by rabies.

quote: We passed a few sad hours until eleven o'clock, when the trial was to commence. My father and the rest of the family being obliged to attend as witnesses, I accompanied them to the court. During the whole of this wretched mockery of justice I suffered living torture.

Nor did it occur to one of us there
To doubt they were kneeling then.
So fair a fancy few would weave
In these years! Yet, I feel,
If someone said on Christmas Eve,
‚ÄúCome; see the oxen kneel,

quote: The clock told him it was eleven forty-three and in that moment, in a flash of illumination, Mungo understood what the numbers at the end of Moscow Centre's messages were

author: Ruth Rendell

quote: "At eleven forty-four last night somebody stabbed this girl in the neck with a kitchen knife and immediately thereafter plunged the same knife through her skull, where it remained."

author: Ben Elton

quote: It was a quarter to twelve when the service was over. When he reached home, the bishop undressed and went to bed at once without even saying his prayers.
title: The Bishop
author: Anton Pavlovich Chekhov

quote: It was fifteen minutes to midnight, when the dead‚Äîaccording to Celia‚Äîthrew off their coffin lids like so many blankets. Stop that, Matt told himself.
title: The House of the Scorpion
author: Nancy Farmer

quote: Billy‚Äôs plan lasts until quarter to midnight. He‚Äôs been watching some action movie in his underwear, and although the plot is simple‚Äîsomething about a guy seeking revenge on the men who killed his dog‚ÄîBilly has lost the thread. He decides to call it a day.

quote: The church clocks chimed three quarters past eleven, as two figures emerged on London Bridge. One, which advanced with a swift and rapid step, was that of a woman who looked eagerly about her as though in quest of some expected object; the other figure was that of a man...
title: Oliver Twist
author: Charles Dickens

quote: We struck the tow-path at length, and that made us happy because prior to this we had not been sure whether we were walking towards the river or away from it, and when you are tired and want to go to bed, uncertainties like that worry you. We passed Shiplake as the clock was striking the quarter to twelve and then George said thoughtfully: "You don't happen to remember which of the islands it was, do you?"
title: Three Men in a Boat
author: Jerome K. Jerome

quote: In the Kismet Lounge, Mr. Early sees suddenly to his horror it's 11:46 p.m. He's been in this place far longer than he'd planned, and he's had more to drink than he'd planned. Shame! What if, back at the E-Z, his little girl is crying piteously for him?
title: Doll: A Romance of the Mississippi
author: Joyce Carol Oates

timeString: Thirteen minutes before noon or midnight
quote: "Because the two curses that have struck here in Chicago arrived at eleven forty-seven in the morning, and damned close to that last night. Add two hours to the deaths in California to account for the difference in time zones. The curse was sent at the same time. Thirteen minutes before noon or midnight."

author: Jim Butcher

quote: If he had glanced at his watch, he would have seen that it was thirteen minutes to midnight. And if he had been interested in what was going on, he would have heard the voices and bawling of terrified men.

quote:
It was near midnight.
Torvik took the doll which had been left on the couch in the study, after first having mended its broken foot.

author: Bo Giertz

quote: It was near midnight when she left the Palace in a clothes-hamper borne by two porters, covered with her own soiled smocks and petticoats which were supposedly being carried to the laundress.

author: Kathleen Windsor

quote: Littell arranged a private charter. He told the pilot to fly balls-to-the-wall. The little two-seater rattled and shook-Kemper couldn't believe it. It was 11.48 pm. They were thirty-six hours short of GO.
title: American Tabloid
author: James Ellroy

quote: Tom shrugged. He pushed his pinkish ruffled sleeve back, and saw that it was eleven minutes to midnight. Tom finished his coffee.
title: The Boy Who Followed Ripley
author: Patricia Highsmith

quote: The clock on the wall read ten to midnight. Cork wanted to turn the hands back, do it all differently, be in all the right places at all the right times. He wanted a second chance at the last few days. The last few years.

author: William Kent Krueger

timeString: wants ten minutes, hardly more, to the awful midnight hour
quote: "Oh, Mr. MacLear," he said jocularly, "I am glad you have just managed to escape breaking the Sabbath! You have had a close shave! It wants ten minutes, hardly more, to the awful midnight hour!"

author: George MacDonald

quote: At 11.50 pm, I got up extremely quietly, took my things from under the bed, and opened the door one millimeter at a time, so it wouldn't make any noise.
title: Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close
author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quote: Virginia checked her watch: nine minutes to twelve. She had kept her side of the bargain. She pressed the doorbell and waited until she saw a light on the third floor go on.

author: Jeffrey Archer

quote: "Due at Waterloo at eleven-fifty-one," panted Smith. "That gives us thirty-nine minutes to get to the other side of the river and reach his hotel."
title: The Mystery of Dr. Fu Manchu
author: Sax Rohmer

quote:
And then the VCR broke.
I heard the wheels spin, then whine, then screech, then stop. I hit ‚Äúeject‚Äù and nothing happened. I poked at all the buttons. I unplugged and replugged the machine. I picked it up and shook it. I banged on it with the butt of my hand, then a shoe. Nothing was working. Outside, it was dark. My phone said it was January 6, 11:52 P.M.
title: My Year of Rest and Relaxation
author: Ottessa Moshfegh

quote: It was eight minutes to midnight. Just nice time, I said to myself. Indoors, everything was quiet and in darkness. Splendid. I went to the bar and fetched a tumbler, a siphon of soda and a bottle of Glen Grant, took a weak drink and a pill, and settled down in the public dining-room to wait the remaining two minutes.

author: Kingsley Amis

quote: ‚ÄúIt most certainly is, my darling. I‚Äôm just returning the vases.‚Äù She looked again at her watch. ‚ÄúI think you‚Äôll find it‚Äôs seven minutes to midnight, so I‚Äôve kept my side of the bargain.‚Äù

author: Jeffrey Archer

quote:
It was near midnight.

title: The Hammer of God
author: Bo Giertz

quote: It was near midnight when she left the Palace in a clothes-hamper borne by two porters, covered with her own soiled smocks and petticoats which were supposedly being carried to the laundress.

author: Kathleen Windsor

quote: It was nearing midnight and the Prime Minister was sitting alone in his office, reading a long memo that was slipping through his brain without leaving the slightest trace of meaning behind.
title: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: Midnight is approaching, and while the peak of activity has passed, the basal metabolism that maintains life continues undiminished, producing the basso continuo of the city's moan, a monotonous sound that neither rises or falls but is pregnant with foreboding.

author: Haruki Murakami

quote: His watch read 11.54 pm Eastern Standard Time. Already it was nearly 6.00 am in Rome. He had left a city frozen by a harsh January storm, after a bleak, wet Christmas season.

author: Greg Tobin

quote:
The band began playing ‚ÄúAuld Lang Syne.‚Äù
‚ÄúEleven fifty-five,‚Äù she said, glancing at the gold watch on her pendant. ‚ÄúI really like ‚ÄòAuld Lang Syne.‚Äô How about you?‚Äù

author: Haruki Murakami

quote: As Ness arrives at Union Station, the giant clock tells us it is five minutes to midnight. This is significant, because humans consider midnight a time when bad things happen. Midnight is the Ides of March of the hours in the day! "Five minutes to midnight" is therefore excellent foreshadowing. After all, it is almost directly equivalent to "Five minutes to very bad things happening".
title: Set My Heart to Five: A Novel
author: Simon Stephenson

quote: "I am going to lock you in. It is-" he consulted his watch, "five minutes to midnight. Miss Granger, three turns should do it. Good luck."
title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: It wanted five minutes to twelve, when the premonitory symptoms of the working of the laudanum first showed themselves to me. At this time, no unpractised eyes would have detected any change in him. But, as the minutes of the new morning wore away, the swiftly-subtle progress of the influence began to show itself more plainly. The sublime intoxication of opium gleamed in his eyes; the dew of a stealthy perspiration began to glisten on his face. In five minutes more, the talk which he still kept up with me, failed in coherence.
title: The Moonstone
author: Wilkie Collins

quote: The human race is at the end of the line, the doomsday clock ticks on. It's stopped for a decade at four minutes to midnight, but there the hands still stand. Any minute now they'll begin to move again.
title: Wicked Women
author: Fay Weldon

quote: "It said three minutes to midnight. That didn't seem so very late in the mood I was in. I put on my dressing-gown and took my pocket torch with me and went to Sally's room."

author: P.D. James

quote: "Eleven fifty-seven," he said. Wells nodded. By the old woman's calendar I've got three more minutes.

author: Cormac McCarthy

quote: You got to let the world go to hell in its own way, Gard, two minutes to midnight or not.

timeString: one minute and seventeen seconds before midnight
quote: Humans emerge one minute and seventeen seconds before midnight. The whole of our recorded history, on this scale, would be no more than a few seconds, a single human lifetime barely an instant.

quote: At a minute to midnight, Roquenton was holding his wife's hand and giving her some last words of advice. On the stroke of midnight, she felt her companion's hand melt away inside her own.
